title: Event Manager
job_category: Advertising / Media, Events / Promotions, Marketing / Public Relations
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
COMPANY
We are a boutique consultancy firm dedicated to helping small and medium-sized businesses worldwide fast-track their business growth using capital mechanisms. With over a decade of experience, we have engaged with numerous SMEs, enabling us to identify common challenges and pain points. This wealth of knowledge allows us to tailor our programs specifically to guide and mentor aspiring SMEs, preparing them for their transformative journey towards Capital Entrepreneurship. We are expanding rapidly regionally and we look forward to having additional aspiring marketing personnel to be part of our growing strong team.
Job Description
We are looking for an Events Manager who thrives on interpersonal interactions, an extrovert that engage regularly with clients and key stakeholders. The candidate must be passionate about inbound communications and most importantly, excited in driving and managing a community of SMEs and to manage our events successfully. The candidate must plan and produce our signature events across countries. Set protocol and SOPs for the respective event teams. Set target and deliver KPIs for event ticket sales.
As part of the marketing team, you will be responsible for our members’ engagements and with our brands, leaders, speakers and educational framework. As an Event executer, you will support the events that we held every week.
CRITERIONS
• Lead and execute our hybrid educational events across several markets, support the planning and smooth execution of tradeshow, conferences, seminars, event sponsorships and exhibitions.
• Plannig and executing the right communications mix (comprising inbound emails, group text messages, social media PMs and/or other similar chat platforms)
• Providing timely reporting on engagement metrics and post event analysis.
• Play an integral part in building and maintaining warm yet professional communications with prospects, members and other key stakeholders, contributing towards our robust lead management processes.
• Manage communications with our network of corporate partners and strategic partners to lead development
• Achieve weekly targets set for attendance of events by members and qualified, warm leads.
• Regularly identify clients with positive testimonies for contents marketing team to create relevant clips and quotes
CREDENTIALS
At least 3 years of relevant working experience in a similar role
• Competent in planning and executing tradeshows, conferences, seminars, event, sponsorships and exhibitions
• Effective in communicating with stakeholders who prefer English and Mandarin
• A team player who is positive, enthusiastic and has an open mindset to learn and pick up new skills
• Comfortable with the use of IT equipment and software applications used for conferencing, or webinars
CAREER
· Promotion pathway; Middle Management of a listed company
· Acquire Skills; Management, Leadership, Mentorship
· Acquire Know-how; Business Model (Scalable & Sustainable)
· As Capital Entrepreneur, Entrepreneurship environment & development
Interested candidates do send us your resume via WhatsApp or Telegram to 87141919 or email to hr@pifcapital.com. Candidates who are able to start work immediately would be a plus.
We apologize that we will only respond to shortlisted candidates. Thank you for applying.

title: Events Executive
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Roles & Responsibilities
Prospecting, managing, fronting, and owning all events/project-related activities, from the point of project kick-off/initialisation to actual project launch/implementation.
Working closely with internal and external stakeholders to produce and refine project timelines, milestones, and other relevant documents timely.
To liaise and work closely with venue owners, organisers, and vendors.
Identifying obstacles, proactively mitigating risks and escalating issues to be resolved effectively and early.
Applying and enforcing existing company SOPs and best practices to ensure assigned projects are managed effectively and efficiently, while continuously reviewing and suggesting strategies to improve project management processes and workflows.
Management and coordination with events’ main contractor or vendors for site setup.
Reporting to the Head of Fundraising, Marketing and Volunteer Management.
Required skillsets:
Experienced in events management. Having experience setting up digital experiences will be a plus.
Proven ability in stakeholder management to effectively interact and communicate with stakeholders across different levels and backgrounds.
High emotional intelligence and maturity to handle the rigors of not only day-to-day project management, and operations but also people management.
Excellent presentation skills with the ability to write and articulate well, whether over email, phone, video-conferencing platforms, or in person.
Resourceful and a team player with strong analytical and planning skills.
Proactive in seeking out the best market practices and opportunities.
Familiar with the social service sector will be an added advantage.
Basic Requirements:
Min. 2-3 years of project management experience.
Proven track record in successfully managing successful events.
Minimum Diploma or Bachelor’s Degree in related courses.
Excellent interpersonal, networking and communication skills.
Able to work independently and a team player.

title: Senior Events Executive
job_category: Advertising / Media, Events / Promotions, Hospitality, Travel / Tourism
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Who are WE?
we are AUX – the best team dedicated to planning and executing any event.
Since 2001, we have been trusted by some of the biggest and most exciting brands. From large-scale colourful festivals and extravaganzas to intimate activations and events, our work aims to create fans and advocates for our clients.
What about YOU?
The Senior Events Executive will form a part of the events team and manage all our events. The role will involve handling projects from start to finish, therefore candidates will need to understand all aspects of event management from the initial brief to conceptualisation, formulation, pre-event planning, on-site production, execution and bringing the event to fruition.
Responsibilities
Understanding and conceptualisation of events/formulation of proposals based on stakeholders’ requirements
Assist the team in managing and coordination of major events, campaigns and projects
Assist the team in managing and overseeing project deliverables and deadlines
Assist the team in managing event budgets, expenses, targets and margins
Prepare and conduct post-event evaluation; including data entry, analysis and producing reports for the management or stakeholders
Take on any other responsibility as assigned by the team manager or management
Requirements
At least 1 to 2 years related experience in the MICE or Events Management industry
Experience in a similar role as an Events Executive, similar capacity or higher
Possess a can-do attitude
Have an eye for detail
Passionate about the events industry
Able to work long/irregular hours and/or weekends due to nature of events
If the above resonates with you, apply today!

title: Project Executive (Events)
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
We’re looking for a bundle of energy who’s independent, reliable, a self-starter, a go-getter, a problem solver, and a doer.

If that doesn’t mean a thing to you, let’s break it down in practical terms.

We have lots of enquiries, so we need someone to follow up, work out a proposal and quotation, and then close the deal.
Once we’re awarded a project (could be physical, virtual or hybrid events), we need someone to work closely with the client to ensure that the project is executed perfectly (well, nearly, since absolute perfection is just a concept).
While working on the project, you’ll face many problems. That’s where your problem-solving skills come in.
Sometimes you’re working in a team, sometimes you’re alone, and sometimes we’re working from home, and that’s why we need someone that’s reliable and independent.
We’d love it if you had some experience in events management (physical, virtual & hybrid) and account management so that you can hit the ground running and help us hold the fort.
If you are that someone, we’d like to speak with you!

Requirements

Degree in Mass Communication, Marketing, Business Administration, Advertising / Media, Hospitality / Tourism / Hotel Management or equivalent
A burning passion for events
Team player
Attention to detail
Willing to work hard and put in long hours with a positive attitude
Honest, with good work ethics
Must be willing to learn, curious, tenacious, and resilient
Experience in client servicing is preferred
A good appreciation and understanding of technology is advantageous

title: Sales & Events Executive / Manager
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
About Us
Since our humble beginnings in 2005, The Lo & Behold Group has been quietly pushing the boundaries of Singapore’s lifestyle and hospitality landscape. Whether we’re building Singapore’s first rooftop bar from ground-up, or ironing out the creases of Asia’s top fine-dining restaurant, all that we do comes down to one thing: People. We’ve found that when we design for people and create magical experiences in the process, we’re able to bring out the best of a city. Its people, their purpose and places. The Lo & Behold Group strives to create timeless experiences for all who walk through our doors—guests, partners or employees. The dream is simple: to make our city more lovable, through bold ideas and intentional hospitality.
Claudine is a neighbourhood French restaurant (Neo-brasserie), presenting an intimate side of French cuisine, inspired by honest home-cooking and convivial meals. A concept by Julien Royer and The Lo & Behold Group.
We are looking for a service-driven individual to oversee the Sales & Events function at Claudine. Directly involved in the annual business plan, a deep insight into the current market trends and events sales opportunities is critical in ensuring targets are promptly met. The role encompasses both the importance of building customer relationships and selling to customer needs, as well as a detailed understanding of the management of back-end systems and databases.
You’ll be in-charge of:
Proactively sourcing business potentials for the restaurant in target industries via demographics, market forces, and key partnerships
Establish and build marketing resources such as customer database to build deep, personal relationships with key clients, event partners, and third-party sales
Assisting in the servicing of clients’ accounts to achieve target revenue and personal/team monthly sales goals while maximizing profitability
Handling and managing all aspects of planning and coordination for confirmed groups and events in all market segments
Working closely with the organizers to plan and orchestrate all group and event requirements prior to the event day
Cross divisional work coordination on different aspects of the restaurant’s event services
Ensure well planning with the organizers in order to clearly communicate the requirements and details to operating departments of event execution and service delivery on the event days
Prepare quotations and event options for clients based on leads from existing events management platform
Planning for and liaising with clients and suppliers.
Managing event logistics, and support in presenting post-event reports or post mortems.
Performing other tasks or projects as assigned by the leadership team at the restaurant.
Who we're looking for:
Well-versed in hospitality operations
Meticulous and well-organised
Well-groomed and possesses good communication skills
Passionate about the industry, able to maintain high standards of service quality

title: Senior Events 3D Designer
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
We are looking for a creative Senior 3D Designer to create 3D visual concepts, to communicate innovative designs for our events and pop-up exhibitions.

If you have a creative mind and want to create memorable design for experiential projects in the world of luxury, fashion and premium lifestyle, this is your chance!

We are looking for a talented Senior 3D Designer to join our team to produce events and exhibition scenography design that will make an impact. You will work with a dynamic creative team, focused on concept, quality, and creativity.

We would like experienced and enthusiastic candidates with fresh ideas. If you like to push boundaries and bring new ideas to the table, and is updated on current trends in events, branded exhibitions and activations, you will enjoy working in Lumina.

BENEFITS
Good remuneration package, including project-based incentives
Profit sharing for qualified senior team members
Great team environment
Annual Dental, Optical & Medical Entitlements
Hospital & Surgical Insurance Entitlements
2-days flexible Work from Home arrangements per month (bi-weekly)
Off-in-lieu provided for work on weekends and public holidays
Good opportunities to work on overseas projects for wider exposure
SCOPE OF WORK
Research, analyse, conceptualize and design in 3D for different types of clients based on various project specifications
Conceptualize and implement set and spatial design for events and exhibition production in the luxury, lifestyle and FMCG sectors
Accurately interpret project brief requirements, understand visual communication objectives and interpret the ideas into photorealistic 3D rendering with good lighting effect (and animation if possible)
Able to produce detailed layout plans and technical drawings in AutoCAD or similar software
Create concepts and designs that fit within available project budgets
Site surveys, analyze and take measurements for detailed drawing
Liaise with production vendors for both construction and print, &
Work closely with our account servicing team and production team in ensuring the design is aligned with the client’s requirements from conceptualization to production.
CRITERIA
Diploma / Degree qualification in exhibitions and interior design or equivalent
Minimum 6 years experiences in lifestyle, luxury and fashion events or experiential exhibition design
Very competent in using and creating modelling from layout plans and sketches, knowledge of related visualization and photorealistic rendering technique
Creative, imaginative and enjoys being challenged to produce high quality scenography and design concepts for events and branded exhibitions
Able to interpret brand guidelines and create 3D designs that reflect the brand requirements
Well-versed with 3D Studio Max, V-ray, AutoCAD, Photoshop, Illustrator and / or Sketchup
Good communication skills and a team player
Strong design background with a clear and proven understanding of spatial design, illustration design and layout
Strong AutoCAD skills for technical drawings
Interest in luxury, fashion or FMCGs industries preferred, &
Ability to time manage and work on multiple projects at the same time.

title: Marketing Executive - Event space (REIT)
job_category: Advertising / Media, Marketing / Public Relations, Real Estate / Property Management
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
You will report to the Advertising & Promotions Manager and carry out the normal
duties and responsibilities associated with the post of Advertising & Promotions
Executive, including inter alia, the following tasks:-

To actively plan, promote and market the use of the event or foyer space, and the company's properties to other organizations for the staging of events which will draw crowds and create excitement, while at the same time ensuring the generation of income.
To actively promote and market the use of advertising spaces in the building and the company's properties to other organizations ensuring the generation of income, while at the same time maintaining the prestigious image of the building.
To coordinate and liaise with all relevant parties on requirements for approved exhibitions and events.
To supervise all on-going events and exhibitions to ensure compliance with the rules and regulations governing the use of event space , and with the relevant Authorities.
To coordinate and liaise with the two anchor tenants on all centrewide promotions, and keeping all shopping centre tenants informed on the upcoming promotions.
To assist in the preparation, production and circulation of periodic circulars/articles to tenants on building matters relating to the company.
To assist in the update of the company's website on a regular basis.
To assist in the managing of enquiries and complaints received from tenants and/or members of the public, and to ensure that the matters brought up are attended to promptly by the relevant parties and/or a reply is made, in consultation with your Superior or Management
Requirement:
Degree / Diploma in Business or Marketing or relevant studies
